alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Marion; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 9:15PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Sequatchie, Marion and Hamilton Counties through 1100 PM EST/1000 PM CST/... At 1015 PM EST/915 PM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near South Pittsburg, or 9 miles west of Jasper, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Jasper, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, South Pittsburg, Walden, Lakesite, Whitwell, Kimball and Ridgeside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
